findings.title: No checks if liquidity to mint is zero
findings.description: In functions ArrakisV2.mint() and ArrakisV2.rebalance(), there are no checks if liquidity to mint is zero, which can cause transaction reverts.

findings.title: First minter can skew the initial ratio
findings.description: In the function ArrakisV2.mint(), it is possible to skew the initial ratio in a certain case due to division being rounded up.

findings.title: getAmountsForDelta reverts for liquidity < 0
findings.description: The getAmountsForDelta function in the Underlying library reverts when the liquidity parameter is less than 0 due to SafeCast.toUint256 reverting as the input is negative.

findings.title: Inconsistent function name
findings.description: The Underlying library has a function computeMintAmounts that returns only one parameter - mintAmount.

findings.title: Zero address check
findings.description: The ArrakisV2Storage contract's _whitelistRouters function allows adding zero addresses as routers.

findings.title: Magic number
findings.description: The ArrakisV2Storage contract's setManagerFeeBPS function has a check for a managerFeeBPS_ input variable, it has to be <= 10000. This number already has a named variable which could be used here.

findings.title: Zero address _arrakisV2Beacon for ArrakisV2FactoryStorage
findings.description: **ArrakisV2FactoryStorage** allows creating factory with zero address for **_arrakisV2Beacon**. Also, owner can't change **arrakisV2Beacon** after creation.

findings.title: Zero address factory_ for ArrakisV2Resolver
findings.description: **ArrakisV2Resolver** allows creating a factory with zero address for **_factory** and owner can't change **factory** after creation.

findings.title: Inconsistent event name
findings.description: All ArrakisV2Storage contract's events have a 'Log' prefix except one - LPBurned.
